column8: Nancy Stamm has been giving fine art instruction to children for over eight years. Children five years old thru adults learn how to take the frustration out of creativity when drawing and painting. They develop better hand skills and coordination while practicing their art lessons. A sense of accomplishment and positive thinking as well as problem solving are achieved through art. In the classroom each student focuses on their own individual skills. Here they receive instruction designed specifically for their individual needs and skill levels
Hayes Sewing Machine Company of Delaware is a locally owned and operated fabric and sewing machine store that happens to offer some sewing/stuffed animal making classes.
Jen’s Pottery Den is a Paint-Your-Own pottery and craft studio located in the heart of Manheim Township.

Middle School Program
Cherry Court Studios is for children in grades 5 through 9 who love to draw. Classes are small. Lessons suit the unique developmental needs of middle school. This foundation enrichment program will enhance learning that follows in high school and college. Each student is mentored according to his/her unique personality, learning style, and combination of talents. Perhaps one day innovative professionals in many fields will recall Cherry Court Studios as their place for monumental beginnings.

Upper School Program
Upper School at Cherry Court is for students in grades 10 through 12 who wish to progress as far as is possible in these areas: developing a high quality portfolio, discovering the beginnings of a personal style, pinpointing artistic strengths, and preparing for competitions.

Each student at Cherry Court is unique, with a personal range of talents, experiences, interests, and ambitions. This program's goal is to mentor each student based on those qualities, providing an environment of support and encouragement. Emphasis will be placed on setting goals and working to achieve them. Guidance concerning higher education and how to excel at that level will be integrated into instruction.

Cherry Court Studios only accepts students to the Upper School who have been part of the middle school foundation program. It is important for students and parents to recognize that to excel in any discipline, students must begin studies early and practice often, electing both school district classes and participating early in extracurricular programs.

column1: The Allegra School of Music & Arts
column8: Since 1999 the Allegra School of Music and Arts has successfully educated thousands of students of all ages in piano, woodwind, brass, percussion, guitar, strings, voice, drama, and musical theater.
Founded in 1945, Pittsburgh Center for the Arts is a non-profit community arts campus. The Center is where the community can create, see, support and learn about visual arts.

The Philadelphia Guild of Handweavers is a non-profit organization whose mission is to foster the art and craft of weaving and the fiber arts.

We were organized in 1952 through the efforts of Joseph Acton, Bret Carberry, Ruth Dewees, Marion Lord, Helen Schobinger and Kathryn Wellman.

In 1992, Russ Fawley, owner of Wilde Yarns, deeded the property at 3705 Main Street, Philadelphia, PA to the Guild. This building is located in the Manayunk area of Philadelphia (across from the United Artist Theater) and is now the permanent headquarters for the Guild. It offers ample space for meetings, workshops and classes.

Membership in the Guild offers not only the chance to increase learning but to be part of a community of other fiber artists. The Guild motto is “We Learn by Doing and Grow by Sharing”.
A paint your own pottery and sign language studio

Since its founding, the Cheltenham Center for the Arts (CCA) has served as a venue for high quality classes, exhibitions and theater programs that have promoted regional artists and showcased the work of children, adults and outstanding faculty in our community.

At CCA we believe that the arts can offer to all ages a means to broaden your horizons, learn new skills and explore new ways of seeing the world. It is our goal to provide a creative environment to nurture that process
Weekend All-Ages Paint Parties available for children and their families.

The Art Association of Harrisburg, founded in 1926, is a hub of Central PA cultural events.  The galleries in the historic Governor Findlay Mansion across from Riverfront Park provide exhibition opportunities for regional and nationwide artists. The AAH also offers art classes for children and adults in Central PA.

PALETTE KIDS INC is an independent fine arts studio for children ages five and older whose atmosphere is conceptualized through your child imagination and artistic visions.
The life long dream of Philadelphia bred POP ARTIST PERRY MILOU; ‘’Palette Kids’’ embodies a simple credo…one hundred percent freedom of creativity for your children 100 percent of the time. We call our concept…. unstructured structure! Simply put, the studio sets limitless artistic boundaries for your child inspirational desires. Whether it be a 3-d Matisse inspired goldfish stillife, a New York City skyline diorama, or a paper mache stiletto… the palette kids orchestrate the show
Our mission will always remain focused on developing the fundamental skills and teaching of fine art Children are encouraged to explore drawing, painting and sculpture from life It is this emphasis that has envisioned the studio’s creation of a larger than life 8 ft sketch pad to sharpen your child’s most basic yet important artistic skills. Large gestural drawing exercises are practiced frequently, while techniques in all mediums are taught from basics to very advanced levels.
The studio’s youth program operates daily, specializing in dynamic classes that are small and individualized. On weekends Palette Kids caters to birthday parties and special events for all ages. Children are also offered the exciting opportunity to go ’’one on one’’ for private instruction with Perry!
Milou, a nationally recognized and prolific pop artist brings his diverse talents and pedigree to ignite a daily open studio encouraging your child’s fascination of art to flourish at every opportunity. The development of the studio in Philadelphia’s renown Rittenhouse Square area is the artist’s finest contribution to date. An art educated for over 20 years, Perry’s love of children and sparkling personality creates a dynamic hybrid of professionalism, safety and fun to all of his students.

column1: St. John's School of the Arts
column8: The philosophy and purpose of the Saint John's School of the Arts (SOTA) is to offer the children, youth, and adults of the Greater Williamsport area a school devoted to excellent training in music and the fine arts, in an atmosphere and environment supporting the Christian ethic. An average of more than 200 students (per semester) enroll in our year-round programs!

column4:
The Schoolhouse Business Center
10 Cherry Avenue, Suite 204
column8:
Becky Mayhew attended the Art Institute of Pittsburgh where she graduated with honors in 1980. She worked as both a full-time and freelance artist doing graphic design, caricatures, cartooning, drafting & illustration.
beckyOver the past 25 years her teaching experience has included a wide range of subjects including: general art curriculum, yearbook, drafting, graphic design, and drama at Lakeview Christian Academy in Bridgeville, PA. She has also taught caricature workshops at the Art Institute of Pittsburgh and has been a guest lecturer at Duquesne University, and several local art leagues.
Since the inception of The Art Shoppe in 2004, Becky has taught a wide variety of classes that include all drawing and painting mediums and subjects, cartooning and calligraphy to large and small groups as well as one-on-one classes with ages ranging from grade school through adults. She enjoys seeing the look of amazement on the faces of new students who never thought they could draw or paint and having that sense of accomplishment when they finish a piece of art. One of her sayings is, “Most people think they can’t draw– perhaps it’s because no one ever taught them how.”

Pittsburgh Glass Center is a nonprofit, public access school, gallery and state-of-the-art glass studio dedicated to teaching, creating and promoting glass art. World-renowned glass artists come here to make studio glass art. People interested in learning more about glass come here to take a class, explore the contemporary glass gallery and watch live hot glass demonstrations.

Monart is more than a method that teaches people to draw.  Leading educators recognize Monart as a way students can use several learning styles by teaching them how to focus and concentrate, make decisions, solve problems, plan, sequence and develop hand-eye coordination.  Just like a student learns to perceive what they wnat to draw in terms of basic elements of shape, and to develop the skills they need to translate that information on to paper.  Since 1979, Monart has been taught around the world.  The Monart method has achieved astounding results with children and adults without previous training or "talent."  A desire to learn to draw is all that is required.

  Each week the lesson is planned by the instructor on a particular theme, giving enough structure to insure success, and enough freedom for independent creativity.  In a non-competitive, peaceful environment students are taught that there is no wrong way to draw.  The curriculum is balanced and includes a wide range of subjects and media.

  Mona Brooke's best selling books, Drawing With Children and Drawing For Older Children and Teens, are available in book stores.  Established 1979. Visit Monart website for schools and more information: www.monart.com

The LCAA is the County's oldest arts organization offering support for the visual arts through exhibition opportunities for artists as well as art classes, workshops, special programs, and opportunities to see the work of local artists and artists from outside of Lancaster County in special exhibits.

Founded in 1988 by Bette Fetter, Young Rembrandts has become a recognized leader in art education. What began as one person, working with children in her home, has developed into an international business that teaches drawing to thousands of students every week.

Fetter applied her fine arts education and background in child development to create an original, step-by-step method to teach children drawing, the fundamental skill of all visual arts.

Research and education experts say what Young Rembrandts has always delivered: there is a significant correlation between involvement in the arts and achievement in the classroom. Children who learn to draw using the Young Rembrandts method develop spatial reasoning and fine motor skills, order and sequencing abilities, visualization, and self-discipline as well as fundamental art skills. Our original curriculum introduces concrete ideas and techniques that enlarge their visual vocabularies, enrich their imaginations and their minds.

Today, Young Rembrandts partners with pre-schools, elementary schools and community centers to either augment or supply their art education programs. Young Rembrandts has a solid reputation for offering well-organized classes and teaching original, high quality curriculum in a positive environment.

CMS offers private instruction in accordion, bass, cello, clarinet, flute, flutophone, guitar, percussion, piano, piccolo, recorder, saxophone, trombone, trumpet, voice, violin, viola. CMS also offers various opportunities for ensemble work. Some of the ongoing groups include CMS Chorus Kids, Fusion Vocal Ensemble,  Silver Winds Flute Choir, Thursday Flute Choir, Impressions Jazz Ensemble. Several new ensembles are listed in our guide also. And, you learn an assortment of repertoire from Bach to Rhythm and Blues, pop – jazz – Latin – contemporary – and classical; what is your favorite? In addition, CMS offers multiple performance opportunities once you are ready to perform. Find it here, learn from some of the best professional musicians in the Lehigh Valley and perform with others! CMS is home to Budding Musicians!

CMS also offers coaching sessions to help any student with special needs for performance. Are you in a play? Are you looking to enroll in a Charter School? Need theory for college? CMS can help you on your musical journey

Our mission is to empower the children and adults of our community with opportunities to develop their artistic abilities, awaken the imagination, and build self-esteem and confidence.  Through the Arts we provide a safe haven for our community to nurture creativity, diversity, literacy and health for the betterment of all.

By building self-awareness, and appreciation of one's own inner creativity and artistic skills, we aim to transform the lives of individuals, improve their academic and economic success and awaken a person's social and civic sense in order to raise the quality of life in our neighborhoods.

At Mermaid Art Studios, the world of creativity and imagination are yours to explore.

In addition to our full list of classes and workshops, we are available at your convenience for custom projects by appointment only

Greater Norristown Art League, Inc. is a non-profit organization with a 501 (c)(3) status engaged in the promotion and teaching of the Arts. Founded in 1941 and chartered in 1957, it is located in the Old Norriton Schoolhouse and is one of E. Norriton Township's "Historical Resources."

We offer day and evening classes for adults and children, workshops in all media, exhibition opportunities, life classes, Saturday classes and summer camps for children. Our monthly meetings are free and open to the public.
SVPA is a non profit organization dedicated to exposing educating and inspiring the public in the arts.

Since 1947 Marks Music has artfully paired thousands of students with “the perfect” instrument choice. Marks Music offers only superior quality band and orchestral instruments which will withstand the rigors of elementary school, middle school, and especially the demands of high school marching band. Instruments for beginners, step-up horns, and professional models are all available at the store. Because Marks Music services each instrument it sells, only the most reliable instruments will be sold.
The Marks Music team has been around for four generations and so have many of its customers. It is an everyday sight to see grandparents, who once studied at the store and purchased instruments in the 1940’s, who are now bringing in their grandchildren and sometimes great grandchildren for instruments and for lessons. We are proud that we have been able to be a part of their musical experiences and we are proud to have served the Shenango Valley for 64 years.

column4:
Fairmount Art Center
2501 Olive Street, Philadelphia, PA 19130

Queen Village Art Center
514 Bainbridge Street, Philadelphia, PA 19147
column8:
Fairmount Art Center, founded in 2004 and Queen Village Art Center, founded in 2011 are members of Art Mark llc and are resources for creative education, serving the greater Philadelphia area.

We offer a wide range of program for adults and children.  Programs include weekly classes, one-time workshops, parties for all ages, single-day camps whenever schools are closed, week-long summer camps, a full after school program with walking pick up at area schools, private lessons, art therapy, music classes, and much more!

Our goal is to develop dynamic, creative thinkers while fostering joy for arts and self expression. We believe that what occurs during the process of art making is paramount. We strive to balance an approach that supports creative problem solving with age-appropriate skill and concept development.

Our directors, faculty, and staff are passionate about the important role art plays in learning, life, and community and we work exhaustively to bring you outstanding, exciting, and creative opportunities grounded in current educational theory. The Art Center’s highly skilled faculty offer diversity of experience with noted accomplishments as professional artists and educators. Students young and old experience a warm and welcoming atmosphere that fosters joy for creative learning! Let’s Get Creative!

The Conservatory provides individualized instruction to meet the needs of our students. Lessons are available from the primary level through preparation for college auditions. Adult and homeschooled students are always most welcome. 

We encourage our students to participate in a variety of musical programs that may include recitals, festivals, ensembles and chamber music concerts. We offer private instruction in: Piano, Strings, Woodwinds, Brass, Voice, Theory, Composition and Early Childhood Music Studies.

FOCUS ON TEACHING - We specialize in one thing - providing the highest quality of instruction in music, art, and theater.
UNIVERSITY TRAINED TEACHERS - Our instructors are highly qualified and many have extensive performance experience. Most importantly, our instructors strive to relate their teaching to each individual student's learning style.
ALL AGES - BEGINNERS TO ADVANCED - Our current students range from 4 years of age to senior citizens. We take care to teach what you want to learn so music is rewarding for students of all ages and levels.
INSTRUMENTAL AND VOICE LESSONS - We offer private and small group lessons.
REGULAR CONCERTS AND RECITALS - Recitals and concerts are held at least twice a year. These provide students with performance experience and build confidence. Participation in music festivals, competitions and workshops is also available.
COMPUTER LAB AND THEORY WORKSHOPS - After a music lesson, students spend thirty minutes working on theory, drills and games.
THEATER PROGRAM - From the age of 5, children are exposed to the basics of drama and musical theater in a fun supportive group environment. This builds a solid foundation for confidence in communication and performing.
ART PROGRAM - We offer art for ages 6 to adult. Painting and drawing in all media allow all to express creativity and originality while learning principles of arts.

Our mission is to help develop an appreciation and education of the fine arts, literary expression and related cultural endeavors to all ages. We are devoted to fostering the arts in both the local and regional communities.

The Conservatory is a non-profit organization, offering a wide range of high quality arts education and performance programs in music, art, and drama. We provide individual lessons and group classes, music therapy, recitals, concerts, workshops, and community outreach projects. The Conservatory has been serving the communities in Bucks and Montgomery Counties and New Jersey since 1988. The Conservatory is a Member of the National Guild for Community Arts Education, the Central Bucks Chamber of Commerce, the Doylestown Business and Community Alliance, and the Arts and Business Council of Greater Philadelphia.

Drawing on More than 25 Years of Education, Participation, and Appreciation
From encouraging art shows in public spaces to teaching popular local art classes to arranging trips and other special events, the North Penn Art Alliance (NPAA) offers artists and art enthusiasts opportunities to create, learn, network, and grow in a supportive environment.

As a town grows both in population and in reputation it is only natural for an arts organization to emerge and take shape. Thus in 1999, SHAPE was founded when a few business owners, university faculty members and local artists got together. They recognized a need for an orgaization to promote the arts in Shippensburg. Since its inception, SHAPE has hosted close to 100 gallery exhibits, held hundreds of art classes, organized house tours, arts events, culminating with the creation of the annual Solstice Arts Festival.

Pottery Playhouse is your destination for all sorts of occasions — an out of the ordinary date night, a girls night out, a birthday party to remember, a team-building corporate outing, and the party ideas go on and on!! We can also bring the party to you with our Art Mobile. Want a one-of-a-kind piece for a special occasion? Then let Pottery Playhouse's own artists design custom art for you.

Art Center offering art education and appreciation for adults and children via classes and exhibitions throughout the year.

The Chester County Art Association is a non-profit cultural organization that promotes participation in the arts through quality instruction, exhibitions, and community outreach. CCAA believes that art does make a difference and has enhanced the community by involving people of all ages and aspirations in the arts since 1931.

Voice lessons are available in 60, 45 and 30 minute sessions. You can schedule on a weekly or a bi-weekly basis for a technique and coaching session, a technique only session or a coaching only session.

The Studio accepts beginners and advanced students from 8 years old and up. Lessons provide individualized instruction in breathing, placement, voice building, pitch perfection, singer movement on stage, stage presence and microphone technique; with coaching in all styles of music.

The Baum School of Art is a community school dedicated to providing instruction, guidance and encouragement for children, adults, and those who wish to pursue college-level studies to reach their highest level of technical, physical, spiritual, creative, and emotional potential through the study of the visual arts. The School values the diversity of its population, including, but not limited to, gender, creed, social status, or race. This mission is deeply rooted in service to the community.

Good technique is the basis for any great dancer, and this training starts at the very beginning and should be stressed throughout any and all dance training.  There is no pressure for students to perform at any given level, only encouragement to do one's best. We turn the words "I can't" into "I can't....YET". There is also no competition among students.  All Academy students will dance in a happy environment full of respect and compassion for each other, where a good attitude is as just as important as ability.

Settlement Music School’s mission is to provide the highest quality instruction in music and the related arts to children and adults, regardless of age, background, ability or economic circumstances. Settlement’s broad range of programs, taught by highly credentialed and dedicated faculty, help students achieve artistic, educational and social goals.

Terri Perpich is an award winning Pittsburgh artist and photographer ~ exhibiting regionally, nationally and internationally.  She teaches classes in her Natrona Heights studio/business and specializes in custom art ~ calligraphy and portrait photography ~ including high school senior pictures.  Terri is also a speaker on "Careers in Art" ~ offers groups drawing ~ painting ~ and multi media demonstrations ~ and has been a judge for regional art exhibitions.

* Art & Calligraphy Classes for children (ages 6 and up) teens & adults ~ new classes are always forming

Sweetwater Center for the Arts offers more than 500 classes, workshops, and lectures annually in the visual, performing, literary and culinary arts to both adults and children beginning at age 3.  Sweetwater's multidisciplinary approach includes classes in ceramics/sculpture, cooking, music, drawing, painting, photography, dance, jewelry, fiber arts, and traditional crafts.

The mission of the York Art Association is to encourage and develop interest in the visual arts; to provide opportunities for education through classroom instruction, workshops, lectures, and publications; to support interaction within the community; and to provide a venue for members and non-members to exhibit their work in a gallery setting.

Color Me Mine Montgomeryville offers...
Walk-in painting! * Reservations for larger groups * Birthday Parties (for all ages) * Adult Classes * Kids Classes * Canvas Painting Classes * Mommy & Me Workshops * Holiday Events * Baby Showers * Bridal Showers * Bachelorette Parties * Scout Troop Programs * Fundraisers * Summer Camp * To-Go Events * Custom Work * We can tailor any event to your needs! Just ask!

Art classes for children ages 5 and older and adults. We offer a variety of mediums: watercolor, acrylic and oil painting, colored pencil, pastel, and clay sculpture. We have samples for the kids, so they can pick and choose what they want to work on. We sit right down with them and show them how to do it. I only take 10 to a class and 5 to a teacher, so your child will get all the attention he or she requires. $80 per month for 4 one hour classes, supplies are included.

Guitar lessons are personalized for each student. Each guitar lesson consists of one-on-one time where the student is respected and empowered to take ownership over their musical life. My students experience their lessons as being enjoyable, productive and rewarding. Over time, they naturally learn how to apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to other areas of their lives.

column1: Alchemy Open Studio Therapeutic Arts Center
column8: Alchemy Open Studio (AOS) is a public benefit non-profit corporation that provides therapeutic arts programs for individuals with developmental, psychological or physical challenges.

Art Partners Studio looks to a future where everyone in the greater Coatesville region has access to high quality arts education programs and the opportunity to actively participate in artistic experiences that enrich their lives and the life of their community.

Pottery & Painting on Canvas. A Great Party Place. 
Join us during open hours, or make an appointment, and we can accommodate on non-scheduled hours.
Description
painting on canvas & Ceramics, glazing pottery, Build a Buddy animal stuffing, art workshops
General Information
Come in anytime to paint pottery during open hours. Any posted hours that are closed, we will come in by appointment, party or special class. Please Check to see if we have anything going on, because we open the main area for pottery painting if we have something scheduled . Hope to see you soon!

non-profit arts organization 
celebrating more than 50 years of 
service to our Montgomery County 
community. OAC, a vibrant, welcoming
space for artists, offers painting 
classes for adults and children, 
demonstrations and workshops in all 
media, exhibition opportunities, and 
more.

The Community School of Music and the Arts offers a wide variety of programs for children and adults in Visual Arts, Instrumental Music, Voice, Dance, Theater and arts-intergrated preschool and after-school programs.

column1: West Chester Studio for The Performing Arts
column8:
West Chester Studio for the Performing Arts is a community-wide acting and musical theater training program. Our teachers are experienced professional actors who provide a high-caliber performing arts education to students of all ages and abilities from Chester County, Delaware County, Wilmington and Philadelphia.
Students gain confidence and are encouraged to take risks in a fun, nurturing and safe environment. At the Studio self-discovery through the Meisner Technique is a critical component in the development of quality acting skills. As each student develops they begin to recognize the importance of his or her own voice.  With their new acting tools performers learn how to put their voice out into the world.
Our goal is to help propel the serious actor into the business while nurturing the novice. Our schedule of classes is designed with students academic studies in mind.

RIVER'S EDGE STUDIO strives to foster a love of the arts in people of all ages and support all forms of creative arts by creating a place for local artists to show their work and art lovers of all types to find unique pieces at affordable prices in a positive and comfortable atmosphere

Artists of Yardley (AOY) is a non-profit organization, dedicated to nurturing the creative spirit of the community by educating and  encouraging individuals to experience, appreciate and share in the arts. Established in 2004, we continue to grow with over 250 members, exhibiting professionals and all others interested in the visual arts.  In 2010, AOY adopted the historic Janney House on Patterson Farm in Yardley, PA as their new home and art center. Located in the heart of Bucks County, the panoramic views of the surrounding farmland complements the organization's aesthetic tenor.

The AOY offers classes in all media, weekend workshops and summer camps for children and young adults. Our exciting and innovative programs are taught by professional-level instructors.

column3: none listed on either facebook or site
column8: Muses Graces And Fates Academy of Stroudsburg, PA offers professional musical, instruction for children and adults. We are located next to the Sherman Theatre. We love what we do here in Muses Graces And Fates Academy. Count on our teaching methods, and our experienced and accredited teachers, who are known for their patience, for quality lessons in the performing arts. We offer a variety of musical lessons including: classical, rock, jazz and folk.

Classes consist of diverse projects that develop
artistic skills. We invite the enthusiastic and advanced 
student to Summer Kamp.

column1: Banana Factory Arts and Education Center
column8:
The Banana Factory is the Lehigh Valley's cultural arts & education center. The center is owned and operated by ArtsQuest.
Description
Three galleries** 26 resident artists with studios on the 2nd and 3rd floor** Hot Glass Studio** Digital Imaging Center** Ceramics Studio** Jewelry Studio** Mosaic and Sculpture Studio**Darkroom** First Friday Celebrations**Classes of all kinds, for all ages**Gallery Shop**Art for Sale**InVision Photo Festival and Lehigh Valley Photography Month**Giving back to the community with free art programming for risk youth and job skills training programs** Scholarships Available!!!
In addition to offering classes, the Whitemarsh Art Center hosts several events through out the year, such as Art in the Park, Wine Galas, Chili Bowl Dinner and Craft Market.

column1: C Barton Mccann School Of Art
column8: C. Barton McCann School of Art, a 501 (c) (3) organization, is located just outside State College and offers a unique environment to support emerging artists of all ages. The natural setting cultivates a relationship between art and nature encouraging aesthetic awareness and creativity. This multisensory experience develops an inter-disciplinary curriculum for students to create and explore new horizons of artistic expression. Under the guidance of committed instructors, students discover new techniques and media. The school’s hands-on, experiential approach helps young artists gain confidence in developing and expressing their own personal language.

Aura Ceramics started in Easton over thirty years ago and we are enjoying ceramics more everyday. We can proudly say we are teaching some families third generation. With four certified teachers we have combined over 100 years experience in ceramics as teachers,artists and sculptors. For the children we have Saturday morning classes from 10:00 a.m.to 12:00 p.m.
No parents allowed, this is the children's time to create and create they do. Our certified teacher instucts them in all of the proper and latest techniques

Our arts center works to have 6 week cycles for art classes in drama, photography, music, and fine art. We also have workshops in many areas of art.

The mission of the Allegheny Center for the Arts is to provide a creative, educational hub for arts and culture that offers opportunities for growth, development, and the partnership of arts-related programs and 
small businesses in the region.
Unleash your inner artist at Mine By Design Art Studio. Choose from paint your own pottery, glass fusing, clay molding, and so much more! We have something for every age and experience level.

Pottery Works Mobile is a unique, personally tailored experience for any group to enjoy. With the hard work of our staff, PWM has introduced a new and exciting way for groups of any size, whether at the home or other location, a chance to flex their creative muscles. It is an unparalleled experience that allows you to not only connect with your friends, but your hidden artistic self. Our staff takes participants through the exhilarating stages of creating unmatched works (because they're yours!) of clay art that can be used for decoration or even practical uses around the house.

Craftforia partners with local elementary schools, community centers, and churches to provide after school craft workshops for kids ages 8 and up. The programs are designed to nurture creativity while also supplementing academic learning. Each program follows a theme and consists of 5 two-hour sessions.  Kids will learn fun facts and make a craft to take home.
We are a non-profit classical art school whose mission is to preserve and advance the classical arts.
Offers classes in once a month, 4 and 10 week intervals.  Also offers summer camps and birthday parties.

ArtWORKS!: An after-school program for middle school students that promotes self-esteem and giving back to the community through the arts.

Art Classes, Camps, and Lectures: Educational opportunities for both children and adults in a variety of mediums.
Classes from 3 year olds to 93 year olds!!
The Carnegie Performing Arts Center is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to providing quality performance opportunity and  dance education.

Bluebird Art is an art studio designed specifically for children ages 6-14. Developmentally age appropriate classes are taught by PA certified 
teachers

Walk-in Arts & Crafts Studio for children, teens, and adults. 

Welcome to Artsy Doodle Craft Studio, a walk-in arts and craft studio for kids and adults. We have a wide selection of craft activities, such as paint your own pottery (yep-we have a kiln), paper mâché, canvas painting and even spin art.  You can also decorate dollhouses, superhero capes, princess/fairy tutus, wands, and wings.  At the embellishment bar you will find unlimited paint, accessories and all things that sparkle.  It’s a great place to hang out for some special bonding time with family and friends. There’s lots to doodle at Artsy Doodle!

Art Classes for ages 2 and up, After School Art Programs, Homeschool, Fine Arts Classes, Summer and Vacation Art Camps,Birthday Art Parties, Painting Parties, Craft Classes, Art Enrichment Programs for Schools.

Handcraft Workshop is a fabric boutique and sewing studio located in the delightful Mt. Airy neighborhood of Philadelphia. The shop carries a select inventory of designer fabric, sewing notions, and other crafting materials. Handcraft Workshop also teaches the joy of sewing and other handcrafts to children and adults in its two sewing studios. The sewing classes offered by Handcraft Workshop are designed for students with skill levels ranging from the very beginner ("I can't sew a button on shirt!") to advanced ("You like my skirt? I made it!").

We are a family owned and operated studio which opened its doors for the first time in June 2012. Our instructors are art certified educators who are dedicated to your success!

We currently offer:
* Birthday Parties/Scout Parties
* Seasonal Parties for Kids
* Hourly Art Instruction - Now Enrolling      for Fall Classes
* Open Studio Time
* "Mommy and Me" classes
* Adult Workshops

West Point Ballet is directed by former dancers of National Ballet of Cuba, Florida Classical Ballet, Columbia Classical Ballet, and Pittsburgh Ballet Theatre. The school is sure to provide superior dance education that is both enjoyable and rigorous for every age and level of instruction.
Creative Arts, Studio Arts, History of Arts, Paint Your Own Pottery, Crafting galore, Craft Clubs, and more! Paint. Create. Express & Connect.

column1: Silvi's Little Art Studio for Kids
column8: would need to call.....website doesnt work only facebook

column1: Out of Our Minds Art Studio
column8: Out of our Minds" is an art studio located in the Lehigh Valley, instructing students in fine arts. Painting, sculpture, and drawing are just some of the designs students will learn and refine in the studio.
Art Studio offering traditional art classes for kids and adults as well as SMArt engineering design classes for kids. Art school, camp and cooking lessons.
Lille Syster is a paper flower making studio. We are open for workshops and birthday parties. By appointment only.

column1: The Yocum Institute For Arts Education
column8: Classes in Visual Art, Theater, Dance, Music including private instrumental and voice.

The arts are essential to human development and the well being of society. The Community Arts Center is dedicated to providing a nurturing environment for artists at all levels of their creative journey, encouraging participation in the arts.
ARTstart is an arts-based early childhood program that runs for the full school year – three mornings a week with an option for four mornings.
Lucky Charms is an afternoon arts enrichment program for 3 to 5 year olds.  Each day of the week has a special theme from music to photography to clay!
University City Arts League is a nonprofit organization dedicated to education and cultural enrichment in the arts. We serve people of all ages in our diverse community.

Our Music Together classes build on your child's natural enthusiasm for music and movement. We'll help you provide your child with the basic musical skills needed to enjoy school and social musical activities, and to study an instrument should he or she choose to do so.

We have so much fun in music class. It's really a family music experience where we celebrate each other while sharing music, movement, and a little silliness.

The mission of the Tott's Gap Arts Institute is to nurture artists of all ages, and to awaken the excitement, passion, and possibility of both the fine and performing arts by offering classes, showcasing talent, and hosting events that will infuse our community and the region with a love and respect for the creative process.

column1: Pottery Works In Historic Downtown Lancaster
column8: open paint your own pottery studio

Historic Yellow Springs, Inc. is a nearly 300 year old historic village that is the home to a vibrant arts center as well as a number of historic buildings and structures. We have over 100 acres, and a collection of art, artifacts, and archives for research, education, and community involvement. The grounds are open to the public 365 days a year dawn to dusk. Explore a unique 'living' village with a 300 year old history. Check our website for all the art classes, exhibitions, events and programs that happen year round.
